places.name: Takshashila
places.description: Ancient university known for Ayurveda, Politics, and Grammar.

places.name: Nalanda
places.description: One of the world's first residential universities, center for Buddhist studies.

places.name: Kashi (Varanasi)
places.description: Home of Sushruta, father of surgery. Site of ancient knowledge transmission.

places.name: Pataliputra
places.description: Capital of the Maurya and Gupta empires, a hub of administration and culture.

places.name: Dwarka
places.description: The legendary city of Lord Krishna, believed to have been submerged in the ocean.

places.name: Ujjain
places.description: Ancient city and center of learning in Astronomy and Mathematics.

places.name: Mathura
places.description: Birthplace of Lord Krishna, famous for its temples and sculptures.

places.name: Ayodhya
places.description: Birthplace of Lord Rama, the capital of the Kosala Kingdom.

places.name: Prayag (Allahabad)
places.description: The confluence of the Ganges, Yamuna, and Sarasvati rivers, a spiritual and historical center.

places.name: Rajgir
places.description: Ancient city in Bihar, associated with Buddha and Jainism.

places.name: Somnath
places.description: Site of the first Jyotirlinga of Lord Shiva.

places.name: Rishikesh
places.description: A center for Yoga and Vedic studies, located on the banks of the Ganges.

places.name: Pushkar
places.description: Famous for its temple of Lord Brahma and the sacred Pushkar Lake.

places.name: Bodh Gaya
places.description: The site where Lord Buddha attained enlightenment.

places.name: Madhurai
places.description: Home to the famous Meenakshi Temple and a significant center of Tamil culture.

places.name: Chidambaram
places.description: Famous for the Nataraja Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva.

places.name: Kanchipuram
places.description: Known for its historical temples and silk weaving.

places.name: Kanyakumari
places.description: The southernmost tip of India, famous for its temples and natural beauty.

places.name: Hampi
places.description: The ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

places.name: Sanchi
places.description: Known for its ancient stupas and Buddhist monuments.

places.name: Elora Caves
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, home to a vast complex of temples and monasteries.

places.name: Ajanta Caves
places.description: Ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves known for their exquisite frescoes.

places.name: Tiruvannamalai
places.description: A major pilgrimage center with the sacred Arunachaleswarar Temple.

places.name: Varanasi
places.description: One of the oldest cities in the world, a significant religious center for Hindus.

places.name: Chola Empire Capital (Thanjavur)
places.description: The capital of the Chola dynasty, known for its great temples and art.

places.name: Kolhapur
places.description: Famous for its Mahalaxmi Temple and the Kolhapuri chappals.

places.name: Anuradhapura (Sri Lanka)
places.description: A significant city for Buddhism, with many ancient ruins.

places.name: Kolkata (Calcutta)
places.description: One of the cultural hubs of India, known for its colonial-era architecture.

places.name: Tirupati
places.description: Famous for the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple, one of the richest pilgrimage sites.

places.name: Shirdi
places.description: The home of the revered saint Sai Baba.

events.title: Sushruta – Father of Surgery
events.description: Sushruta lived around 600 BCE and wrote the Sushruta Samhita in Kashi.

events.title: Panini – Sanskrit Grammar
events.description: Panini composed the Ashtadhyayi, laying the foundation for Sanskrit grammar.

events.title: Nalanda Flourishes
events.description: Nalanda University becomes a global hub for Buddhist and scientific studies.
